description: This is the data dictionary for the Sentinel Mother-Infant Data Quality Assurance and Characterization Program Package.

inputfiles.name: inputfiles
inputfiles.description: Input files are used to parameterize the program.

datasets.description: This table is used by the control flow module to selectively and sequentially execute QA MIL Package modules. It is also used in the L1 and L2 modules to selectively execute data checks by SCDM table. This table contains one row per integrated module.

variables.description: Abbreviated name of the module to be executed.
Indicates whether the specific module will be executed.

values.value_map: Yes. The module will be executed.
No. The module will not be executed.

variables.description: Full name of the SAS program module. Case sensitive and should contain no spaces or special characters except `.`, `_`, or `-`.
Common Components (CC) macro variable used by all modules, including the QA MIL Package master program. Used to provide DP and ETL-specific SCDM table names to the QA MIL Package.

Utilization table indicator.  This variable is no longer used by the QA MIL Package functionality, but indicates which tables are broken out from all Encounter claims by the DP (e.g. Encounter, Diagnosis, or Procedure).

values.value_map: Yes. The table is a utilization table.
No. The table is not a utilization table.

datasets.description: This SAS output table provides a list of SOC-assigned error codes (FlagID) and descriptions (Flag_Descr), and the name of the output dataset used to evaluate checks associated with the error code.

variables.description: A unique error code representing an individual data check.
Indicator for implication of the data check for passing or failing an ETL under review.

values.value_map: The ETL cannot pass QA review until fixed.
The ETL may be able pass QA review, pending Quality Assurance Analyst Review.
This flag is for characterization or reference purposes. It does not generally affect the ability of the ETL to pass QA review.

variables.description: Indicator for implication of the data check for the QA MIL Package. AbortYN = `Y` is used to indicate checks that must pass in order to complete the QA module successfully.

values.value_map: Yes. The QA MIL Package will abort if this flag is present.
No. The QA MIL Package will not abort if this flag is present.

variables.description: Token indicating the SCDM table or tables associated with the data check.
FlagID token indicating Level of data check.  See [Quality Checks](#qmr-quality-checks) for details on the levels of checks.
Token indicating DMQA-assigned variable identifier representing the primary SCDM variable associated with the check.

values.value_map: Two-digit number representing the variable number in the SCDM table.
00 represents table-level check that is not associated with a specific variable.

variables.description: Token indicating Laboratory test identifier associated with the test.

values.value_map: Token indicating a labratory test with a quantitative result.
Token indicating a labratory test with a qualitative result.
Token indicating a check that is not associated with a specific laboratory test.

variables.description: Token indicating unique data check identifier.

values.value_map: Three-digit number representing the check number.

values.value: SCDM variable name as it appears in the model
SCDM variable name as it appears in the model
SCDM variable name as it appears in the model
SCDM variable name as it appears in the model

variables.description: SCDM Lab table test name as it appears in the model.

values.value_map: Numeric. Quantitative or semi-quantitative test results.

values.value: Free text description of the data check.

variables.description: Indicates the QA MIL Package output dataset used programmatically as the base of the check.  This may be deleted when no longer needed for processing.
Indicates the name of the lookup table required for the check.
Indicates whether the data check is automatically executed by QA MIL Package or not.  Most Level 1 and Level 2 checks will have FlagYN=Y.

datasets.description: output table provides information on all variable attributes by SCDM table in order to perform Level 1 model compliance checks. For each variable in the table, the variable identifier, required type (numeric or character), and required length are specified. An indicator of whether a variable is allowed to have a missing/blank value is also included, as well as a list of all allowable variable values (as applicable).

variables.description: Order in which variable should be sorted in the SCDM table.
Unique key variable as defined in the SCDM for a given table. Leave as null if not applicable.
Indicates whether a variable exists across SCDM tables. Leave as null if not applicable.
Indicates whether all records for a variable are required to be populated, only some, or none.
Indicates the type of values required for a variable, such as a finite list, numeric range of values, up-cased values, etc.
Indicates valid values for a variable.
variables.label: ValidValue

values.value: SCDM valid values as they appear in the model

variables.description: Indicates what condition will cause a flag to fail

msoc.name: msoc
msoc.description: Output datasets found in the MSOC directory are returned to SOC.

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per unique FlagID for Level 1 or Level 2 non-passing data checks and associated frequency.

variables.description: Indicates whether flag causes QA process to abort
Indicates if this flag is considered a Warn or a Fail
Count of flagged observations in data set
3 character abbreviation for source SCDM table

notes.text: Where execute_flag=Y and cc_table NE X

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per SCDM table variable and includes the count of non-missing, missing, special missing, and null values.

notes.text: Assigned by the SOC and populated

variables.description: 3 character abbreviation for source SCDM table

notes.text: Where execute_flag=Y and cc_table NE X

variables.description: Count of records populated with SAS special missing values

datasets.description: This dataset contains a comparison of expected SCDM versus actual observed variable attributes by table.

variables.description: 3 character abbreviation for source SCDM table

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per unique FlagID for Level 3 data checks and associated frequency.

variables.description: Indicates QA MIL Package abort status (Y or N) for each FlagID

datasets.description: This dataset is a duplicate of the [all_l1_l2_flags](#qar-all_l1_l2_flags) dataset output as an .xlsx file with additional fields providing context regarding any flags found in that file. dpid will be replaced with the Data Partner callsign and num will be replaced with the appropriate ETL numbere.g., data_characteristics_sign_off_report_nsdp_etl21.

variables.description: Flag ID used by SOC to identify specific error checks across all SCDM tables
Indicates QA package abort status (Y or N) for each FlagID
Count of flagged records from the previous ETL

notes.text: Flag count may be record or PatID count. For cases where count is not applicable, use value '99999'

variables.description: Count of flagged records from this package run

notes.text: Flag count may be record or PatID count. For cases where count is not applicable, use value '99999'

variables.description: Difference in the count of flagged records between the current and previous ETL
Field used by Sentinel Data Partners to indicate that the Data Partner has reviewed each flag
Free-text column for Data Partner to include any information related to the flag that would communicate more knowledge to SOCe.g., Data Partner added a new stream of data

datasets.description: This metadata file contains the number of the ETL under review.

This metadata file contains module-level metadata and basic benchmarking statistics after each module has completed. `level` will be replaced with the appropriate module namee.g., l1_signature, l2_signature.
This table contains counts of linked and unlinked deliveries, stratified by `InfantsLinked`, `EncType`, `AgeGroup`, `ICD_Ver`, `YearMonth`, `Year`, `Birth_Type`, and `LinkageStatus`.
datasets.notes: For details on how to interprete l3_mil_aggregate_deliv level numbers to find stratifications of interest, please see Appendix \@ref(qmr-l3-mil-aggregate-deliv-level-ref).

values.value_map: Various levels of combinations of stratification variables
Mother/delivery not linked to infant (Filled MPatID and null CPatID)

variables.description: Based upon ICD-9-CM/ICD-10-CM codes in the health plan data for the delivery admission.  Will be 0 for non-specific codes

values.value_map: Conflicting code(s) for number of live births

values.value: 20YY-##, where ##= 01--12 and dash is delimiter between values for year and month

notes.text: Should be in range of 10--54 inclusive
Based on unique populated CPatIDs per delivery

datasets.description: This table contains counts of linked and unlinked MIL records where MPatID and CPatID are present, stratified by `MatchMethod`, `DaysDiff`, `sex`, `EncType`, `AgeGroup`, `ICD_Ver`, `YearMonth`, `Year`, `Birth_Type`, and `LinkageStatus`.
datasets.notes: For details on how to interprete l3_mil_aggregate level numbers to find stratifications of interest, please see Appendix \@ref(qmr-l3-mil-aggregate-level-ref).

values.value_map: Various levels of combinations of stratification variables
Mother/delivery not linked to infant (Filled MPatID and null CPatID)
Infant not linked to mother (Filled CPatID and null MPatID)
Linked mother/delivery to infant (Filled MPatID and filled CPatID)

variables.description: Based upon ICD-9-CM/ICD-10-CM codes in the health plan data for the delivery admission.  Will be 0 for non-specific codes

values.value_map: Conflicting code(s) for number of live births

notes.text: Based on ADate of EncounterID, or of CBirth_Date
Based on ADate of EncounterID, or of CBirth_Date
Should be in range of 1054 inclusive

Note - Prioritize so that only one method listed: RE > SI > LA > BC > OT. For cases where a mother/delivery is not linked to a child OR a child enrolled is not linked to a mother/delivery, the value of this variable should be NA. Cannot be blank.

values.value_map: health plan subscriber or family number
exact or probabilistic last name and address match based upon health plan administrative data
No subscriber/family IDs available for linkage
Neither subscriber/family IDs nor name/address available for linkage

datasets.description: This dataset contains resulting output from SAS proc contents for the MIL Table, including table, variable, and engine/host attributes. All variables present, including any non-SCDM variables, will be included in the output.

variables.description: 3 character abbreviation for source SCDM table

notes.text: Where execute_flag=Y and cc_table NE X
SAS proc contents procedure performed on MIL or MIS tables -- Applies to all variables except for the last one documented

variables.description: Number of Indexes for Data Set
Position of Variable in Sortedby Clause
Size of table recorded in bytes

datasets.description: This dataset returns the distance between cbirth_date and cenr_start, stratified by birth year.

variables.description: 3 character abbreviation for source SCDM table

notes.text: Where execute_flag=Y and cc_table ne X

variables.description: SCDM variable ID assigned by SOC
variables.label: SCDM Variable ID

variables.description: YN indicator for variable that is expected as per SCDM
variables.label: Variable expected?

notes.text: Ms_var='Y' if variable is in lookup table

variables.description: YN indicator for presence of variable in DP SCDM table
variables.label: Variable present?

notes.text: If type=1, then dp_type='N', else if type=2, dp_type='C"

variables.description: Observed length of variable in bytes
variables.label: Actual variable length

datasets.description: This metadata file contains DP-specific SAS component license status.
This metadata file contains DP-specific information about ETL number, phase, and SCDM table names.

variables.description: As populated in QA MIL Package

dplocal.name: dplocal
dplocal.description: These datasets are output to the DPLOCAL directory and are not returned to SOC.

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per unique FlagID for [Level 3](#qmr-l3-quality-checks) data checks and associated frequency.

variables.description: Indicates whether a flag will cause the Quality Assurance Package to abort, if thrown.

values.value_map: Flag will cause QA MIL Package to abort
Flag will not cause QA MIL Package to abort

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per unique FlagID for [Level 1](#qmr-l1-quality-checks) data checks and associated MPatID and CPatID frequency.

variables.description: Indicates QA MIL Package abort status (Y or N) for each FlagID

datasets.description: This dataset contains one record per unique FlagID for [Level 2](#qmr-l2-quality-checks) data checks and associated frequency.

variables.description: Indicates whether a flag will cause the Quality Assurance Package to abort, if thrown.

values.value_map: Flag will cause QA MIL Package to abort
Flag will not cause QA MIL Package to abort

datasets.description: This table will include data related to across table checks for all records.

notes.text: M-I Linkage Table or DPLocal.Deliveries file
M-I Linkage Table or DPLocal.Deliveries file

values.value_map: MPatID from the dplocal.deliveries file is not found in MIL Table.
MPatID from the MIL Table is not found in the dplocal.deliveries file.

datasets.description: This table will include data related to across table checks for all records.

variables.description: Infant patient delivery table linkage status
